column2: The Triad is an alliance of Tyr, Ilmater and Torm, supported by a few other less-powerful deities. Together, they strive to oppose injustice and evil in the Realms and beyond.

The arcane magic of the Weave is a fact of life in the Realms, so it should come as no surprise that the deities who govern such matters are given high consideration, particularly in societies dominated by wizards and sorcerers.

The Rashemi faith focuses on the worship of a group of deities known as the Three, known broadly in Faerûn as Chauntea, Mystra (later replaced by Selûne), and Mielikki, as well as a number of nature spirits. Their religion is also dominated by women, and favours arcane spellcasters over others.

The people of Chessenta worship a mixture of western and eastern deities, putting special emphasis on their draconic hero-founder Tchazzar. Their pantheon has mostly a Neutral outlook and focuses both on philosophy and militarism.

Focusing on the worship of Waukeen and Helm, as well as a host of lesser gods, this religion is particularly prevalent in the Lands of Intrigue and tends to concern itself with more mundane matters than Good or Evil.

The deities of knowledge and invention are headed by the god Oghma, who together with his allies seek to preserve and categorize the knowledge of the Realms. Their followers also share in this passion for learning and discovery, and highly value academic pursuits as a result.

Sune Firehair leads a small pantheon of deities related to joy, beauty, and love. These gods encourage the pursuit of happiness and free love, while also condemning war, aggression, and the domination of others.

The practices of the ancient Alzhedo-speaking people of Calimshan share many similarities with neighbouring faiths, but also include a great many unique features as well. Though nearly every deity is acknowledged, a handful are held as being more important and given special consideration. Notably, the faithful accept and venerate powers held as evil by most outsiders.

The people of the Lapal coast have similar practices as their Alzhedo relations, but with the notable difference of how each settlement has its own civic deity that is worshipped almost exclusively there. They also have a distinct distate for reptilian gods due to their historic conflicts with the yuan-ti.

The radical arm of the Church of Chauntea believes that as Chauntea personifies the whole earth, so her worship must be spread to all the ends of the world. Because of that, they are far more prone to proselytising than other Chaunteans.

The Mulhorandi pantheon is headed by Horus-Re and encompasses a host of deities that were brought to Toril in distant times from a distant world, in response to the pleas of their followers who had been enslaved by the ancient Imaskari.

The Untheric pantheon was brought to Toril long ago from another realm, in an attempt to free their followers from enslavement by the Imaskari. Though headed by Gilgeam, many deific wars have extracted a toll on the pantheon and most of its members are dead.

The halfling pantheon is led by Yondalla the Protector and Provider, and encompasses a number of gods held to be her children. The pantheon itself reflects the halfling people, being cohesive and good-natured.
The Solar faith worships either Lathander or Amaunator, varying on worshipper and time period, as the highest god and embodiment of the sun, as well as a small number of related deities.

The deities of fury are a group of gods dominated by Talos, who each embody the destructive side of nature. They tend to be ruthless and vindicative, and use their infamy to instill fear and submission in rival faiths.

The gods of nature are led by Silvanus and encompass those deities who rule over natural forces, with care taken to placate the more destructive powers. They urge their followers to protect natural places and to attempt to attain balance between it and settled peoples.

Kossuth is the primordial of elemental fire whose portfolio is both the destructive and purifying power of flames. His church is hierarchical and impersonal, and mostly does without the guidance from their distant deity. They are opposed in all matters to the servants of elemental water.

§RRival Deities§!: Istishia, [Root.ChaunteaLoc], [Root.AurilLoc]
§RRival Religions§!: Chauntean, Myriadic, Qisma'ite, Pantheist, Infernal, Abyssal, Entropist, Faithless

Grumbar, the primordial of earth, has his own organized faith originating in Zakhara, whose priesthood claimed to be able to interpret Fate through their elemental magics. Geomancers are also unique amongst the elemental cults in that they strive to combine both arcane and divine magic in their workings.

§RRival Deities§!: [Root.AkadiLoc], Urdlen
§RRival Religions§!: Infernal, Abyssal, Faithless, Entropist

The elemental primordials, though usually far more distant than the gods who dominate the Realms, still possess a fair number of followers. Their cults and churches tend to be scattered and heterodox, varying significantly from region to region.

The people of the Endless Wastes follow a small group of nature gods and practice ancestor worship, as well as some beast cults. They do not have any gods they consider to be evil, instead blaming it on malefic spirits.

Uthgar, the Battle Father is the patron demigod of the Uthgardt people. As a mortal, Uthgar was a great barbarian thane who famously slew and was slain in turn by Gurt, the Lord of the Pale Giants. In recognition of his martial prowess, Tempus, Lord of Battles elevated Uthgar to godhood and his followers became his first worshippers, calling themselves the Uthgardt after him.

§RRival Deities§!: [Root.Malar], Helm, Torm, Tyr, [Root.IlmaterLoc], Auril
§RRival Religions§!: Infernal, Abyssal, Faithless, Entropist
The gods of warfare are led by Tempus. He and his fellow gods exhort their followers to be brave and to join conflicts they find. They do not, however, condone senseless slaughter of noncombatants.
The Dead Three are a collective of the deities Bane, Bhaal and Myrkul. Together with some lesser powers they urge their followers to dominate all through terror, murder and the pursuit of power.

People of the Realms who are desperate or unscrupulous often to turn to the worship of deities related shadows, loss and misfortune, the most powerful of which is Shar. These gods usually do not care for the well-being of their faithful, pursuing a more transactional or domineering relationship between god and follower.

Ghaunadaur is the god of abominations, outcasts, oozes, slimes and the False. It is an ancient and unpredictable deity that requires blind obedience and constant sacrifices, though it usually rewards devotion richly. Its church is utterly disorganized, dominated at each moment by the strongest individual present.

§RRival Deities§!: Eilistraee, Gargauth, Vhaeraun, Selvetarm, [Root.Malar], Ilsensine, Maanzecorian, [Root.TalosLoc], Zinzerena, Callarduran Smoothhands, Great Mother
§RRival Religions§!: Eilistraeean, Lolthite, Vhaeraunan, Seldarine, Asathalfinare, Ladugueran, Quallith, Solipsist, Ladugueran, Infernal, Abyssal, Entropist, Faithless

Loviatar is the goddess of agony and pain, and in certain regions is worshipped exclusively. Her faith demands that life is incomplete without suffering, and only by exploring the full range of sensations, positive and negative, can one truly grow as a person.

§RRival Deities§!: [Root.IlmaterLoc], Eldath, Liira, Talona, Gargauth, [Root.SharessLoc]
§RRival Religions§!: Infernal, Abyssal, Entropist, Faithless

Cyric, god of lies, intrigue and madness, is a newly-risen god who insists to his fanatical followers that he is the only true god in existence. His vague and contradictory revelations cause his followers to constantly fight each other over dogma, one of the few things preventing them from infiltrating and sabotaging other faiths.

§RRival Deities§!: Mystra, Kelemvor, Oghma, Azuth, Mask, Tyr, Torm, Deneir, Leira, Iyachtu Xvim, Bhaal, Bane, Myrkul, Helm, Gargauth, Jergal, Milil, Red Knight, Savras, Siamorphe, Velsharoon, Corellon Larethian, Hanali Celanil, Sehanine Moonbow, Baravar Cloakshadow, Segojan Earthcaller, Arvoreen, Cyrrollalee, Urogalan, Yondalla, Bahgtru, Amaunator
§RRival Religions§!: Infernal, Abyssal, Entropist, Faithless

The Demon Princes of the Abyss are not really gods, but still are worshipped as if they were and can even grant boons to their followers. They hate each other as much as they hate the rest of all creation, their only common goal being to draw the entire multiverse into the Abyss.

§RRival Deities§!: Everyone Else
§RRival Religions§!: Everyone Else

Infernal cults worship Asmodeus himself or one of the archdevils under him. Asmodeus himself is a being on the same level as greater deities and holds the portfolio of Indulgence. His cult strives to spread the ideals of Law and Evil, damning as many souls to the Nine Hells as possible in the process, and fighting the servants of the Demon Lords of the Abyss. Azuth, Gargauth and Tiamat are the few and only deities not in constant conflict with the servants of the Nine Hells.

§RRival Deities§!: Almost Everyone Else
§RRival Religions§!: Almost Everyone Else
Most of the reptilian races of the Realms, as well as quite a few humans, worship a set of powers who are either related to the World Serpent, or who claim patronage over various scaled creatures.

The faith of the Ten Thousand Gods is an unusual one for Zakhara. Its adherents believe in the enligthened gods of the continent, but also that all gods, local and foreign, are also merely facets of a supreme divine being. As such, they are far more accepting of religious differences than other Zakharan faiths.

Throughout the lands of Zakhara and beyond, people of all species hold to the faith of the Loregiver, the ancient seeress whose words of wisdom have guided generations of Grand Caliphs. There are many variations on her teachings, but at the centre of all of them is the concept of Qisma: Fate. Fate is not a deity, but an ineffable force of destiny guiding the hearts and lives of the people.
The pantheist religion has very similar beliefs to the Qisma'ite faith, but differs in that they only acknowledge five gods and actively persecute all who do not follow these five deities.

The ancient Muhjari faith was brought to Semphar from Zakhara not long after the time of the Loregiver. The Muhjari faith emphasies right action according to a practical moral code. Being on the crossroads of the continent, a mix of gods from many lands are incorporated in this faith.

The Kahin are an ancient religion of Zakhara who see divinity in not only the gods, but in all things. However, they do not believe that this divine force is focused on anything or has any discernible goal. As such, they strive for balance and moderation, both in themselves and in the world.

The Padhran is a faith whose followers seek to achieve enlightenment and break a cycle of reincarnation by following a code of virtuous behaviour. Though the original Padhra, Surtava, was the first to break this cycle, he was later joined my countless others who transformed into manifestation of Padhra called Padhrasattvas.

The state religion of Shou Lung is based on a written code of behaviour and beliefs held to have been created by the Celestial Emperor himself. The Celestial Emperor is not prayed to directly, being above mortal concerns, and is thus venerated indirectly through his Immortals and Bureaucracy.

The Way is a philosophy of metaphysics that maintain that all things in the universe are influenced by all other things, and influence in turn. They hold that Good, Evil, Law and Chaos do not exist and the only real evil is ignorance, for through it the universe may be damaged.

The most ancient religion of Kara-Tur is more of a set of customs and philosophy than a proper faith. They hold that Heaven is a vast mirror of the Earth, in particular Kara-Tur, with its own government, bureaucracy and ruler. Adherents of this faith of the Nine Travelers worship the nine most powerful members of the Celestial Bureaucracy, and argue about which of them is the leader.
The Seldarine (Elvish: "fellowship of brothers and sisters of the wood") are the elven pantheon of gods that reside on the astral dominion of Arvandor under the leadership of Corellon Larethian.

The Asathalfinare are a multi-species pantheon of good-aligned water gods led by Deep Sashelas. These deities work together to minimize conflict between their followers and oppose the evil deities of water.
Fey creatures of the Realms worship a host of deities and entities related either to nature itself or the feywild. These can include human and elven deities, as well as powerful archfey.

Eilistraee is the drow goddess of beauty, song, dance, freedom, moonlight, swordwork and hunting. She urges her followers to not only reconcile with the surface races and abandon their self-destructive ways, but to also return to and settle the surface in peace.

§RRival Deities§!: [Root.GhaunadaurLoc], Kiaransalee, Selvetarm, [Root.TalosLoc], [Root.MalarLoc], Ghaunadan, Vhaeraun, Ilsensine, Maanzecorian, Zinzerena, Great Mother
§RRival Religions§!: Lolthite, Vhaeraunan, Kiaransaleen, Infernal, Abyssal, Solipsist, Quallith, Ladugueran, Faithless, Entropist

The Church of Lolth is solely dedicated to the worship of Lolth, the fearsome spider-demon goddess of the dark elves, or drow. She demands absolute obedience, and encourages her followers to betray each other whenever possible in order to winnow the weak and hesitant.

§RRival Deities§!: Eilistraee, [Root.GhaunadaurLoc], Gruumsh, Ibrandul, Kiaransalee, Moander, Vhaeraun, Ilsensine, Maanzecorian, Zinzerena, Callarduran Smoothhands, Great Mother
§RRival Religions§!: Seldarine, Asathalfinare, Ghaunadan, Vhaeraunan, Kiaransaleen, Infernal, Abyssal, Ladugueran, Ten Thousand Gods, Qisma, Pantheist League, Faithless, Entropist

Kiaransalee is the drow goddess of vengeance and undeath. She is cruel and vindictive, and possibly insane. Her followers tend to be a secretive bunch, constantly plotting the downfall of all who ever wronged them.

§RRival Deities§!: Eilistraee, Dumathoin, Kelemvor, [Root.JergalLoc], [Root.TalosLoc], Zinzerena, Callarduran Smoothhands, Great Mother
§RRival Religions§!: Eilistraeean, Lolthite, Ladugueran, Seldarine, Asathalfinare, Solipsist, Infernal, Abyssal, Entropist, Faithless

Vhaeraun is the drow god of thievery, shadow magic, and aggressive action. He is the second most frequently worshipped drow god after his mother and enemy Lolth, and the most frequently worshipped drow god on the surface. Unlike his mother, he held the unique view that males and females were equally valuable.

§RRival Deities§!: Cyrrollalee, Eilistraee, [Root.GhaunadaurLoc], [Root.SharessLoc], Ilsensine, Maanzecorian, [Root.TalosLoc], Zinzerena, Callarduran Smoothhands, Great Mother, Astilabor
§RRival Religions§!: Seldarine, Asathalfinare, Lolthite, Ghaunadan, Infernal, Quallith, Solipsist, Ladugueran, Abyssal, Entropist, Faithless
Morndinsamman (dwarven: "shield brothers on high" or "high dwarves") is the collective name of the fourteen deities that form the dwarven pantheon.

The duergar traditionally worship only two gods: Laduguer, god of duergar and magical weapons, and Deep Duerra, goddess of psionics and conquest. The two duergar deities view their former dwarven kin as indolent layabouts who hold tradition over progress. This is reflected in duergar society, where discipline, obedience and ceaseless labour are held above all else.

§RRival Deities§!: Eilistraee, Ilsensine, Maanzecorian, Great Mother, Berronar Truesilver, Clangeddin Silverbeard, Dumathoin, Gorm Gulthyn, Haela Brightaxe, Marthammor Duin, Thard Harr, Callarduran Smoothhands, Shevarash, Urdlen
§RRival Religions§!: Eilistraeean, Lolthite, Ghaunadan, Kiaransaleen, Vhaeraunan, Quallith, Solipsist, Abyssal, Entropist, Faithless

The Lords of the Golden Hills are led by Garl Glittergold, and is composed of a number of deities that all relate to some aspect of gnomish life. Curiously, the gnomish deities tolerate the presence of Urdlen, an evil and violent god, in their midst.

Urdlen the Crawler Below is the gnomish deity of bloodlust, destruction and hatred. It urges its followers to kill and destroy indiscriminately, and that only by appeasing it with slaughter and sacrifices will it spare its faithful.

§RRival Deities§!: [Root.GrumbarLoc], Baervan Wildwanderer, Baravar Cloakshadow, Callarduran Smoothhands, Flandal Steelskin, Gaerdal Ironhand, Garl Glittergold, Segojan Earthcaller, Thard Harr, Kurtulmak
§RRival Religions§!: Orcish, Goblinish, Ladugueran, Morndinsamman, Yondallan, Infernal, Abyssal, Entropist, Faithless
The Giant Pantheon, or The Ordning, is worshipped by all kinds of giants across Faerûn. It is headed by Annam, the lofty and unapproachable chief at the head of this extended family.

Vaprak the Destroyer is the god of greed, destruction, frenzy and violence. He is held to be the progenitor of trolls, ogres and oni. He is widely worshipped by those races, but others, including some true giants, also turn to him through madness or desperation.

§RRival Deities§!: Ulutiu
§RRival Religions§!: Ulutiuan, Morndinsamman, Seldarine, Asathalfinare, Sylvan, Gnomish, Yondallan, Infernal, Abyssal, Entropist, Faithless

The goblin pantheon consists of a number of gods who are nominally ruled by Maglubiyet. He, however, only barely tolerates the other members of his pantheon and often schemes to usurp their portfolios.

The orc pantheon consists of the various gods of the orcs, led by Gruumsh One-Eye. They reside on the plane of Nishrek and mantain that the orcs were betrayed by the rest of the races and their gods, thus justifying the permanent hostility of orcs towards all others.

The Monster Pantheon is a generic grouping of deities who, although generally not worshipped together, share some common similarities. These deities are usually the sole being worshipped by a race of monsters and are often their creator too.
The gods of the dragons are often referred to as the children of Io, the unthinkably ancient Ninefold Dragon who is said to be the god and parent of all dragonkind, good and evil alike.

[Root.BahamutLoc] is the patron of metallic dragons, wind, wisdom and justice, and eternal rival of Tiamat. His followers are expected to fight injustice whenever they see it and his dragon faithful are also expected to temper the less savory aspects of their personalities, such as greed and destruction.

§RRival Deities§!: [Root.TiamatLoc], Null
§RRival Religions§!: Infernal, Abyssal, Entropist, Faithless

[Root.TiamatLoc] is the tyrannical matriarch of chromatic dragons and the eternal rival of Bahamut. Her faith, such as it is, encourages greed, pride and the subjugation of lesser creatures. She is also served by a large number of mortals hoping to gain power or who simply view dragons as natural rulers.

§RRival Deities§!: [Root.BahamutLoc], Gilgeam, Iyachtu Xvim, [Root.IlmaterLoc], Bane, Null
§RRival Religions§!: Abyssal, Entropist, Faithless

The primordial Ubtao is said to be the creator of the land of Chult, founder of the city of Mezro, and father of the land's dinosaurs. He is allied with the wild dwarf god Thard Harr, and together they oppose the deities that seek to overtake Chult.

The primordial Ubtao is said to be the creator of the land of Chult, founder of the city of Mezro, and father of the land's dinosaurs. He is allied with the wild dwarf god Thard Harr, and together they oppose the deities that seek to overtake Chult.
The people of Faerûn's far north often worship Ulutiu, the Sleeper in the Ice, and honour the animal spirits who they believe provide guidance and wisdom.
The people of Faerûn's far north often worship Ulutiu, the Sleeper in the Ice, and honour the animal spirits who they believe provide guidance and wisdom.

The ancient gods of Nog and Kadar were once the patrons of a flourishing civilization. With its collapse and the rise of the Loregiver's teachings, they are now the preserve of a few small groups of worshippers, at the margins of Zakhara.

The ancient gods of eastern Zakhara were once the patrons of a flourishing civilisation. With its collapse and the rise of the Loregiver's teachings, they are now the preserve of a few small groups of worshippers at the margins of Zakhara.
The gods of Maztica are mostly dominant over their continent, and are considered by the people of Faerûn to be bloodthirsty and alien.
The gods of Maztica are mostly dominant over their continent, and are considered by the people of Faerûn to be bloodthirsty and alien.
The Yuir are the native gods of the Yuirwood and its half-elven people. They are related to the elven Seldarine, but also apart.
The Yuir are the native gods of the Yuirwood and its half-elven people. They are related to the elven Seldarine, but also apart.

The Waelan-speaking Ffolk of Moonshae historically worshipped the Earthmother. Many now believe her to have been another form of Chauntea, but there are those who still hold true to the Earthmother as a goddess in her own right.

The Waelan-speaking Ffolk of Moonshae historically worshipped the Earthmother. Many now believe her to have been another form of Chauntea, but there are those who still hold true to the Earthmother as a goddess in her own right.

Adama is a faith from the Shining Lands that believe that everything is part of an unifying divinity called, simply, the Adama and to fully become one with it, one must reincarnate multiple times. Gods are still worshipped, but as aspects of the Adama. Killing is frowned by the faithful, even in self-defense.

The faithless are people who, for various reasons, refuse to worship any gods. While their motivations are countless, their fate is but one: to be doomed to the Wall of the Faithless in the Fugue Plane.

Entropy is a Primordial imprisoned by Ao in a Sphere of Annihilation on Toril as a warning to the gods that they faced annihilation if they displeased the Overgod. Entropy itself cares little for concepts like good, evil, law or chaos and simply seeks to spread its namesake. Entropists are nihilists who seek to empower their god and unmake the world.

The Order of Blue Flame is an organization that holds the Spellplague itself as holy and that it was their duty to expand the plaguelands. They often ventured into territory warped by the Spellplague in pilgrimages to obtain spellscars.

Rarely do Beholders worship gods, for near none can admit there are beings greater than themselves. Instead most Beholders believe themselves to be the closest thing to true divinity, the perfect child of the Great Mother, the progenitor of all Beholderkin.

§RRival Deities§!: Eilistraee, [Root.GhaunadaurLoc], Vhaeraun, Ilsensine, Selvatarm, Zinzerena, Talos, Callarduran Smoothhands
§RRival Religions§!: Eilistraeean, Lolthite, Ghaunadan, Vhaeraunan, Qualith, Infernal, Abyssal, Ladugueran, Faithless, Entropist

As planar creatures, illithids do not worship the powerful entities of the Outer Planes as deities and do not even desire an afterlife in the traditional sense. Instead most mind flayers, with some exceptions, desire to join an Elder Brain upon death. They do however, offer some worship to manifestations of psionic ideals in the form of Ilsensine and Maanzecorian, to the point where these entities can grant divine magic to clerics.

§RRival Deities§!: Eilistraee, [Root.GhaunadaurLoc], Oghma, Vhaeraun, Selvatarm, Zinzerena, Talos, Dugmaren Brightmantle, Shevarash, Auppenser, Great Mother, Callarduran Smoothhands
§RRival Religions§!: Eilistraeean, Lolthite, Ghaunadan, Vhaeraunan, Solipsist, Infernal, Abyssal, Ladugueran, Faithless, Entropist

The Faceless God is the pitiless deity of the yaklike Yikarians. Said to resemble an immense Yikarian with a totally blank face, the Faceless One demands continual devotion and sacrifice, both of Yikarians and lesser species.

Thasmudyan is an infernal god of undeath and the undead who is primarily worshipped in Zakhara. His faithful are called the Cult of Worms and seek not only to advance knowledge of necromancy, but also to spread their god's influence to the mainland.
For centuries the Barae have interpreted Ubtao's will and led our people. Their wisdom and experience will guide our people and strengthen our faith.
Jaziri is the faith of the Cities of the Ancients in the jungles of eastern Zakhara, whose gods are held as "Savage" by the Enlightened religions of the rest of the continent.
Jaziri is the faith of the Cities of the Ancients in the jungles of eastern Zakhara, whose gods are held as "Savage" by the Enlightened religions of the rest of the continent.
In the absence of gods many of the peoples of Abeir have turned to their own ancestors for spiritual guidance, shunning both primordials and dragons that others revere.
The dreams of our religious leaders, and the edicts, the kaiurit, which they inspire, are sacred and inviolable. They will keep us strong if we obey.
Motherhood is at the heart of our faith, and our society should embody our respect for mothers.
Our people's blood must be renewed and purified, as Shajar renews the great river Nogaro.
The time has come to take the fight to the Faerûnian invaders. Zaltec will consume their hearts!
Our people are of two races, human and elven, and two worlds, Faerûn and Sildëyuir. We should draw on all their combined knowledge and understanding to revive the faith.
the Queen of Air and Darkness

My [Root.GetTitle],
I find life here among the [Root.job_spiritual.Location.Religion.GetName] adherents wretched and dangerous, and I am convinced that they are both blind and deaf to the glory of [Root.GetPatronHighGodName]. I plead with you to allow me to return home where I can do more useful work for [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].

Your loyal servant,
[Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName]
This character, while a [GetLordSpiritualName], refused to preach to a populace of another faith, deeming it much too dangerous.

Upon reading the missive,you discreetly retire to the local [Root.Society.GetName] safehouse, where [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] has the [accused_apostate.Society.GetName] [accused_apostate.GetSocietyRank] [accused_apostate.GetBestName] imprisoned and guarded by several [Root.GetReligionWarriorPlural]. "My [Root.GetTitle], this one wasn't even trying to conceal their schemes. How best do we proceed?"

[Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] bursts into your [Root.GetChamber], flanked by several [Root.GetReligionWarriorPlural] dragging [accused_apostate.GetBestName] with them in chains. "My [Root.GetTitle], this [accused_apostate.GetManWoman] has been openly proclaiming [accused_apostate.GetHerHis] allegiance to the [accused_apostate.Society.GetName]! What shall be done with [accused_apostate.GetHerHim]?"

Upon reading the missive,you discreetly retire to the local [Root.Society.GetName] safehouse, where [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] has the [accused_apostate.Society.GetName] [accused_apostate.GetSocietyRank] [accused_apostate.GetBestName] imprisoned and guarded by several [Root.GetReligionWarriorPlural]. "My [Root.GetTitle], this one covered their tracks well, but not well enough. How best do we proceed?"

[Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] bursts into your [Root.GetChamber], flanked by several [Root.GetReligionWarriorPlural] dragging [accused_apostate.GetBestName] with them in chains. "My [Root.GetTitle], I have procured irrefutable evidence that this [accused_apostate.GetManWoman] consorts with the [accused_apostate.Society.GetName]! What shall be done with [accused_apostate.GetHerHim]?"
Get the muscle. Let them have their fun.
Leave [accused_apostate.GetHerHim] here. The [top_criminal] has plans for [accused_apostate.GetHerHim].
Blow [accused_apostate.GetHerHis] cover. See how long [accused_apostate.GetSheHe] lasts.
Gather the criers! Their crimes shall be known to all!

[Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] brings before you a Harper who has been very open about his allegiance to the society.[accused_apostate.GetBestName] explains at length the vital nature of their work in the area, apologizes for the inconvenience,and promises to keep you up to date on [accused_apostate.GetHerHis] whereabouts.

[Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] brings before you a Harper who has been keeping a low profile in your realm. [accused_apostate.GetBestName] tersely explains their reasons for being in your realm, apologizes for the ruckus, and requests permission to remain in the realm.

[Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] brings before you a Harper who has been very discreetly operating in your realm.[accused_apostate.GetBestName] demurs on revealing the extent of their work in the area, apologizes for not making [accused_apostate.GetHerselfHimself] known to the local [Root.GetTitle], and requests to be left alone.
Perhaps I should leverage this opportunity to join them.

[Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] brings before you a member of the fanatical Eldreth Veluuthra who has been very open about his allegiance to the society.[accused_apostate.GetBestName] explains at length the vital nature of their work in the area, apologizes for the inconvenience,and promises to keep you up to date on [accused_apostate.GetHerHis] whereabouts.

[Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] brings before you a member of the fanatical Eldreth Veluuthra who has been keeping a low profile in your realm. [accused_apostate.GetBestName] tersely explains their reasons for being in your realm, apologizes for the ruckus, and requests permission to remain in the realm.

[Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] brings before you a member of the fanatical Eldreth Veluuthra who has been very discreetly operating in your realm.[accused_apostate.GetBestName] demurs on revealing the extent of their work in the area, apologizes for not making [accused_apostate.GetHerselfHimself] known to the local [Root.GetTitle], and requests to be left alone.
The corpulence of the clergy will be their undoing, seize them!
Never! I will not risk the wrath of the gods!

After carefully political manoeuvring, well-timed gifts and consultation with local contacts, I have successfully diffused tensions that have been brewing with some local malcontents over differences in their way of life with the rest of the populace. [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] must surely be relieved!

My [Root.GetLordSpiritualName], [Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName], has successfully diffused tensions that have been brewing in §Y[leaders_met_province.GetName]§!, bringing some level of peace to the area!
My liege, I request another task. Acceptance of your rulership is widespead among the common folk and I can ill think of ways to improve it.

Some of the ambassadors you appointed to build relationships with local leaders have instead allowed the situation to deteriorate. The local peoples has become increasingly resistant to the realm's authority, and may rise in revolt!

Your incompetent [From.GetJobTitle] has fumbled their diplomatic mission in [incensed_province.GetName]! Incidences of disobedience from the local peoples are on the rise, and if not diffused may spiral into violence!
Your incompetent [From.GetJobTitle] has fumbled a diplomatic mission yet again! But on the bright side, minority relations are already as bad as it could be, so there's a silver lining to this.

Send your [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] to appoint ambassadors to local communities of different cultures and religions, easing tensions and diffusing intercommunity animosity. §YDiplomats§!, §YShadows§! and §YBards§! excel at this task.
Despite their significant differences, ambassadors have come to an understanding with local leaders of the area.
Despite their differences, ambassadors have come to an understanding with local leaders of the area.
Due to the ambassadors finding common ground, they have come to an understanding with local leaders of the area.
Thanks to their similarities, the ambassadors easily came to an understanding with local leaders of the area.
The diplomats of the realm have been less than circumspect in their interactions with the local populace.
Offer your soul and lineage in exchange for a mighty boon.

You have achieved much, but it still isn't enough. The prospect of an Infernal contract is ever tempting, and unlike most you have made it far in the cult with the skills and experience to back it up. Perhaps it is time to leverage your experience in dealing with devils...
Beauty. Intelligence. Strength.\nAll three are desirable beyond measure, but signing a contract on firmer, limited terms will be more secure against fine print traps.
Wishing for the world's gold would be a foolish act even for the gods themselves. I should settle on a contract with firmer, limited terms to secure myself against fine print traps.
Even the gods don't work alone. With Infernal backing, I can secure my position in the world against the vagaries of fate.

The pilferage of the realm taxes must be organized for it to be this widespread. Despite the singing of your accursed blood all but confirming the culprit, you conduct investigation after futile investigation in denial.
You have gotten used to suppressing the vile impulses of your blood, but inevitably you slip.\n When you do, it's usually the people around you that suffer.

Sacrifice is as common as it is sudden in the Nine Hells. Nevertheless, losing a child isn't something you get used to, not even as someone as accursed as yourself. The overpowering stench of brimstone offers no other explanation.

The persistent rumours surrounding your Infernal heritage have made their rounds amongst yout troops.\nDesertions are increasing and you can scarcely wrest the bare minimum out of the merchants that supply your baggage trains out of fear.

It is not uncommon for you to be wracked by nightmares so vivid they cause you to be awoken by the pain the shades inflict.\nActual wounds are less common, much less the infected, weeping gashes across your arms.

A pall of misfortune has descended on the realm. The people are laying them blame at your feet solely based on hysterical rumours, and it seems there is not much you can do besides prepare for the worst.
Vassal-Liege relationships can be strained at the best of times. Unfortunately, your latest Infernal outburst has strained things both in the metaphorical and the physical sense.

Your very presence seems to have deleterious effects on your troops, sapping their vigour and spirit. However, physcially keeping a distance from your troops proves to be equally deleterious on their morale.

As it turns out, the contract binds not only you, but your lineage as well. In addition, contractees who fail to serve the Cult of Asmodeus will suffer debilitating "restitutive" action by the forces of the Nine Hells.
I can only rely on myself. I must surpass myself!
Wealth and weapons are ever in short supply.
Success is all about luck and circumstance. I just need a better position.
A sharper mind would have helped with drating this contract.
Could always do with more gold.
A great reputation would go far in securing connections.
More soldiers. You keep what you kill.
Get on my liege's good side. And stay here.
This is worth it. It must be.
My incompetence or the contract? I curse both.
I do not have time for this!
Sigh...So what's the latest on factionalism in the realm?

All your preparations for negotiating with a devil were for naught when you are compelled by a whisper into the oblivion of sleep. As if in waiting, the voice offers eternal beauty in exchange for your servitude and your lineage. Before you can fully process the offer you are swept away with desire. When you wake, you see an idealized version of yourself staring back from your bedside mirror.

All your preparations for negotiating with a devil were for naught when you are compelled by a whisper into the oblivion of sleep. As if sweeping past a dark fog, your newly quickened mind combs through the intricately bound contract by your bedside, surmising that negotiations must not have gone well.

All your preparations for negotiating with a devil were for naught when you are compelled by a whisper into the oblivion of sleep. You come to your senses in your devastated bedroom, the sole object surviving your newly unbrindled power your intricately bound contract.

All your preparations for negotiating with a devil were for naught when you are compelled by a whisper into the oblivion of sleep. You are rudely awoken by the sounds of an army of traders hosting a bazaar outside your holdings, their leader presenting you with a contract.

All your preparations for negotiating with a devil were for naught when you are compelled by a whisper into the oblivion of sleep. You are awoken by the biggest audience your court has ever seen, your intricately bound contract nestled between your feet.

All your preparations for negotiating with a devil were for naught when you are compelled by a whisper into the oblivion of sleep. You awaken to the drills of an army you don't recognise (and no-one acknowledges) with their captain presenting you a contract.

All your preparations for negotiating with a devil were for naught when you are compelled by a whisper into the oblivion of sleep. You wake up feeling unusually invigorated and bump into an intricately bound contract as you stretch.

All your preparations for negotiating with a devil were for naught when you are compelled by a whisper into the oblivion of sleep. You awaken to the odd sight of your family gathered around you in an unnerving display of affection, a bound contract nestled between your feet.

All your preparations for negotiating with a devil were for naught when you are compelled by a whisper into the oblivion of sleep. You awaken to the ruckus of your liege's entourage arriving, a bound contract nestled between your feet.
Offer your soul and lineage in exchange for a mighty boon.
Offer your soul and lineage in exchange for a mighty boon.
Nobody can say for sure why, but the [This.GetTitledFirstName]'s lineage tends to attract the attention of chroniclers across the ages.
The influence of Asmodeus wanes but does not vanish. I will see to reminding the world our Supreme Master's might, and reap the rewards for doing so.
Openly declare the realm's allegiance to Asmodeus.

The ancient [Root.Religion.GetName] religion is proving unable to withstand the onslaught of Fiends and Barbarians. Rather than abandoning the old ways, [Root.GetTitledName] and the most powerful priests have decided to reform the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith in order to ensure a safe and prosperous future for their people.

The ancient [Root.Religion.GetName] religion is proving unable to withstand the onslaught of Fiends and Barbarians. Rather than abandoning the old ways, [Root.GetTitledName] and the most powerful priests have decided to reform the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith in order to turn the tides and lead the assault against the new religions.
column3: L'ancienne religion [Root.Religion.GetName] n'est pas à même de résister aux attaques de la Croix et du Croissant. Plutôt que de renoncer à leur ancienne religion, [Root.Get_le_TitledName], ainsi que les plus puissants prêtres, ont décidé de la réformer afin d'inverser la tendance et mener l'assaut contre les nouvelles religions.
column4: Die alte [Root.Religion.GetName]e Religion erweist sich als unfähig, dem Angriff des Kreuzes und des Mondes standzuhalten. Anstatt die alten Wege aufzugeben, haben [Root.GetTitledName] und die mächtigsten Priester beschlossen, den [Root.Religion.GetName] en Glauben zu reformieren und so das Blatt zu wenden und den Angriff gegen die neuen Religionen zu führen.
column6: La antigua religión [Root.Religion.GetName] está demostrando ser incapaz de resistir la embestida de la Cruz y la Media luna. En lugar de abandonar las viejas tradiciones, [Root.GetTitledName] y los sacerdotes más poderosos han decidido reformar el credo [Root.Religion.GetName] para cambiar las tornas y dirigir el ataque contra las nuevas religiones.

column2: The ancient [Root.Religion.GetName] religion is proving unable to withstand the onslaught of the Fiends and Barbarians. Rather than abandoning the old ways, [Root.GetTitledName] and the most powerful priests have decided to reform the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith in order to defend its followers from infidel invaders.
column3: L'ancienne religion [Root.Religion.GetName] n'est pas à même de résister aux attaques de la Croix et du Croissant. Plutôt que de renoncer à leur ancienne religion, [Root.Get_le_TitledName], ainsi que les plus puissants prêtres, ont décidé de la réformer afin de défendre ses adeptes contre les envahisseurs infidèles.
column4: Die alte [Root.Religion.GetName]e Religion erweist sich als unfähig, dem Angriff des Kreuzes und des Mondes standzuhalten. Anstatt die alten Wege aufzugeben, haben [Root.GetTitledName] und die mächtigsten Priester beschlossen, den [Root.Religion.GetName] en Glauben zu reformieren und so seine Anhänger vor der Invasion Ungläubiger zu schützen.
column6: La antigua religión [Root.Religion.GetName] está demostrando ser incapaz de resistir la embestida de la Cruz y la Media luna. En lugar de abandonar las viejas tradiciones, [Root.GetTitledName] y los sacerdotes más poderosos han decidido reformar el credo [Root.Religion.GetName] para defender a sus seguidores de los invasores infieles.

column2: The ancient [Root.Religion.GetName] religion is proving unable to withstand the onslaught of the Fiends and Barbarians. Rather than abandoning the old ways, [Root.GetTitledName] and the most powerful priests have decided to reform the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith in order to ensure the spread of the worship of the old gods to the four corners of the world.
column3: L'ancienne religion [Root.Religion.GetName] n'est pas à même de résister aux attaques de la Croix et du Croissant. Plutôt que de renoncer à leur ancienne religion, [Root.Get_le_TitledName], ainsi que les plus puissants prêtres, ont décidé de la réformer afin de s'assurer de la propagation de l'adoration des anciens dieux aux quatre coins du monde.
column4: Die alte [Root.Religion.GetName]e Religion erweist sich als unfähig, dem Angriff des Kreuzes und des Mondes standzuhalten. Anstatt die alten Wege aufzugeben, haben [Root.GetTitledName] und die mächtigsten Priester beschlossen, den [Root.Religion.GetName] en Glauben zu reformieren und so die Anbetung und Verehrung der alten Götter in allen vier Ecken der Welt zu gewährleisten.
column6: La antigua religión [Root.Religion.GetName] está demostrando ser incapaz de resistir la embestida de la Cruz y la Media luna. En lugar de abandonar las viejas tradiciones, [Root.GetTitledName] y los sacerdotes más poderosos han decidido reformar el credo [Root.Religion.GetName] para extender el culto a los viejos dioses por todos los rincones del mundo.

column2: The ancient [Root.Religion.GetName] religion is proving unable to withstand the onslaught of the Fiends and Barbarians. Rather than abandoning the old ways, [Root.GetTitledName] and the most powerful priests have decided to reform the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith in order to ensure the preservation of their ancient customs.
column3: L'ancienne religion [Root.Religion.GetName] n'est pas à même de résister aux attaques de la Croix et du Croissant. Plutôt que de renoncer à leur ancienne religion, [Root.Get_le_TitledName], ainsi que les plus puissants prêtres, ont décidé de la réformer afin de s'assurer la préservation de leurs anciennes coutumes.
column4: Die alte [Root.Religion.GetName]e Religion erweist sich als unfähig, dem Angriff des Kreuzes und des Mondes standzuhalten. Anstatt die alten Wege aufzugeben, haben [Root.GetTitledName] und die mächtigsten Priester beschlossen, den [Root.Religion.GetName] en Glauben zu reformieren und so die Erhaltung der alten Bräuche zu gewährleisten.
column6: La antigua religión [Root.Religion.GetName] está demostrando ser incapaz de resistir la embestida de la Cruz y la Media luna. En lugar de abandonar las viejas tradiciones, [Root.GetTitledName] y los sacerdotes más poderosos han decidido reformar el credo [Root.Religion.GetName] para garantizar la supervivencia de las antiguas costumbres.

column2: The ancient [Root.Religion.GetName] religion is proving unable to withstand the onslaught of the Fiends and Barbarians. Rather than abandoning the old ways, [Root.GetTitledName] and the most powerful priests have decided to reform the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith in order to ensure the coexistence of their religion with its new neighbors.
column3: L'ancienne religion [Root.Religion.GetName] n'est pas à même de résister aux attaques de la Croix et du Croissant. Plutôt que de renoncer à leur ancienne religion, [Root.Get_le_TitledName], ainsi que les plus puissants prêtres, ont décidé de la réformer afin de s'assurer la coexistence de leur religion avec ses nouveaux voisins.
column4: Die alte [Root.Religion.GetName]e Religion erweist sich als unfähig, dem Angriff des Kreuzes und des Mondes standzuhalten. Anstatt die alten Wege aufzugeben, haben [Root.GetTitledName] und die mächtigsten Priester beschlossen, den [Root.Religion.GetName] en Glauben zu reformieren und so die Koexistenz ihrer Religion mit ihren neuen Nachbarn sicherzustellen.
column6: La antigua religión [Root.Religion.GetName] está demostrando ser incapaz de resistir la embestida de la Cruz y la Media luna. En lugar de abandonar las viejas tradiciones, [Root.GetTitledName] y los sacerdotes más poderosos han decidido reformar el credo [Root.Religion.GetName] para garantizar la coexistencia de su religión con sus vecinos.

column2: This event could mark the beginning of a new era of pagan revivalism all throughout Toril and spell doom for the Estelar and Akalic usurpers.
column3: Cet événement pourrait marquer le début d'une ère de renouveau païen dans toute l'Europe et provoquer la chute des usurpateurs abrahamiques.
column4: Dieses Ereignis könnte den Beginn einer neuen Ära heidnischer Bewegungen in ganz Europa markieren und die abrahamischen Aufständigen zum Verhängnis führen.
column6: Este evento podría marcar el comienzo de una nueva era de renacimiento pagano por toda Europa y significar el fin de los usurpadores abrahámicos.

column2: By this action, the invaders have made clear that they have absolutely no intention to ever leave Toril.
column3: Par cette action, les envahisseurs du Soleil Couchant ont clairement fait savoir qu'ils n'avaient absolument aucune intention de quitter l'Europe.
column4: Durch diese Handlung haben sie Invasoren aus dem Land der untergehenden Sonne deutlich gemacht, dass sie absolut keine Absichten haben, Europa jemals zu verlassen.
column6: Con esta acción los invasores del Ocaso han dejado claro que no tienen ninguna intención de abandonar Europa.

column2: This might be spell the end for those of all Toril.
column3: Cet événement pourrait mettre sérieusement en péril l'avancée des envahisseurs musulmans à l'Est.
column4: Dieses Ereignis könnte das Vordringen der muslimischen Invasoren im Osten ernsthaft gefährden.
column6: Este evento podría poner en grave peligro el avance de los invasores musulmanes del este.

column2: For the first time in centuries, the authority of the Nomadic Barbarians over Toril is being undermined.
column3: Pour la première fois depuis des siècles, l'autorité de l'Église chrétienne sur l'Europe est ébranlée.
column4: Zum ersten Mal seit Jahrhunderten wird die Autorität der christlichen Kirche in Europa untergraben.
column6: Por primera vez en siglos se ve socavada la autoridad de la Iglesia cristiana sobre Europa .

column2: A Sahuagin Warrior is the bane of all underwater life. Ever hungry, ever vicious, and eager to earn glory, they'll rather die fighting than retreat.
A Sahuagin Chief is oft seen leading a warband of warriors to ravage and plunder the coast. Though more cunning, bloodlust still takes them.
Veterans of many battles, the Sahuagin Baron knows their position is still precarious. Often the pawn of their Princes and target of ambitious Chiefs, they seldom live long.
Having witnessed the fall of many heroes and foolish adventurers, a Sahuagin Prince fears little besides the machinations of their own underlings.
A warlord whose power reaches the farthest depths, this creature recalls the fall of kingdoms. A Sahuagin King is rarely seen, though their is often the woe of all surface dwellers.

A Sahuagin Emperor is a legendary creature to behold, for their memory recalls when Toril was young, and the sea fresh. Few things can challenge this monster in battle, save for True giants and Kraken.
